body.p: Using the completed probability distribution below, explain why it is indeed a legitimate probability distribution.

part.hint: To be a legitimate probability distribution, each probability must be between 0 and 1, and the sum of the probabilities must equal 1.

explanation.p: To be a probability distribution, two conditions must be satisfied.
1. Each of the probabilities must be between 0 and 1. Certainly .28, .34, .18, .14, and .06 are all between 0 and 1.
2. The sum of all of the probabilities must equal 1. Indeed, .28 + .34 + .18 + .14 + .06 = 1.

body.p: Using the completed probability distribution below, show that the sum of the areas of all of the rectangles is one.

part.hint: The area of each rectangle is base times height. The base can be thought of as the width of the interval.
The width of each rectangle is 1.
The height of each rectangle is its probability.

explanation.p: This make sense, since 1(.28) + 1(.34) + 1(.18) + 1(.14) + 1(.06) = .28 + .34 + .18 + .14 + .06, which we already know is equal to 1.
